options.title: -E external[:internal], --encoding external[:internal]
options.description:
Specifies the default value(s) for external encodings and internal encoding. Values should be separated with colon (:).

You can omit the one for internal encodings, then the value (Encoding.default_internal) will be nil.

options.title: -E external[:internal], --encoding external[:internal]
options.description:
Specifies the default value(s) for external encodings and internal encoding. Values should be separated with colon (:).

You can omit the one for internal encodings, then the value (Encoding.default_internal) will be nil.

options.title: -P
options.description: Disables ruby code evaluation for lines beginning with %.

options.title: -S level
options.description: Specifies the safe level in which eRuby script will run.

options.title: -T mode
options.description: Specifies trim mode (default 0). mode can be one of 0 EOL remains after the embedded ruby script is evaluated. 1 EOL is removed if the line ends with %>. 2 EOL is removed if the line starts with <% and ends with %>. - EOL is removed if the line ends with -%>. And leading whitespaces are removed if the erb directive starts with <%-.

options.title: -U
options.description: can be one of Sets the default value for internal encodings (Encoding.default_internal) to UTF-8.

options.title: -d, --debug
options.description: Turns on debug mode. $DEBUG will be set to true.

options.title: -h, --help

options.title: -n
options.description: Used with -x. Prepends the line number to each line in the output.

options.title: -v
options.description: Enables verbose mode. $VERBOSE will be set to true.

options.title: -x
options.description: Converts the eRuby script into Ruby script and prints it without line numbers.
